org.magicdgs.readtools.tools.barcodes

Class AssignReadGroupByBarcode

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.broadinstitute.hellbender.cmdline.CommandLineProgram
      • org.magicdgs.readtools.engine.ReadToolsProgram
        • org.magicdgs.readtools.engine.ReadToolsWalker
          • org.magicdgs.readtools.tools.barcodes.AssignReadGroupByBarcode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.broadinstitute.barclay.argparser.CommandLinePluginProvider

    public final class AssignReadGroupByBarcode
extends ReadToolsWalker
    Tool for assign barcodes to any kind of input and output a standard ReadTools read. See the summary for more information.

      • apply

        protected void apply(scala.Tuple2<org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead,org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead> pair)
        Applies the transformer for fix the barcode, assigns the read group by barcode and writes the read to the output using writeRead(GATKRead). In addition, the reads barcode tags are coupled in case they are not present. Note: the second read read group is identified using the information from the first read.
        Overrides:
        apply in class ReadToolsWalker
        Parameters:
        pair - pair-end reads to process.

      • onTraversalSuccess

        public java.lang.Object onTraversalSuccess()
        Prints the statistics for each barcode into a metrics file and logs the number of records per barcode.
        Overrides:
        onTraversalSuccess in class ReadToolsWalker
        Returns:
        Object representing the traversal result, or null if a tool does not return a value

      • closeTool

        public void closeTool()
        Description copied from class: ReadToolsWalker
        This method is called by the framework at the end of the ReadToolsWalker.doWork() template method. It is called regardless of whether the ReadToolsWalker.traverse() has succeeded or not. It is called after the ReadToolsWalker.onTraversalSuccess() has completed (successfully or not) but before the ReadToolsWalker.doWork() method returns. In other words, on successful runs both ReadToolsWalker.onTraversalSuccess() and ReadToolsWalker.closeTool() will be called (in this order) while on failed runs (when ReadToolsWalker.traverse() causes an exception), only ReadToolsWalker.closeTool() will be called. The default implementation does nothing. Subclasses should override this method to close any resources that must be closed regardless of the success of traversal.
        Overrides:
        closeTool in class ReadToolsWalker
